Description: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO FACILITATE THE RECEIPT AND ACCEPTANCE OF RETIRED USDA LABORATORY EQUIPMENT IN UKRAINE FOR HUMANI TARIAN AID. THE RETIRED USDA SUPPLIES AND EQUIPMENT ARE VALUED AT APPROXIMATELY $245,189 (US) AND ARE BEING DONATED TO SUPPORT TEACHING, RESEARCH, AND/OR EXTENSION IN ANIMAL HEALTH, PRODUCTION, AND WELL-BEING IN UKRAINE. THE AWARDEE SHALL WORK WITH U.S. AND UKRAINE STAKEHOLDERS TO RECEIVE THE SHIPMENT IN UKRAINE AND FACILITATE THE TRANSFER OF ALL ITEMS AND PAPERWORK TO THE GOVERNMENT OF UKRAINE. NO SUBAWARDS ARE ANTICIPATED. THE EQUIPMENT IS FOR HUMANITARIAN AID DONATION AND IS NOT TO BE SOLD.

Award Type: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (B)
Description: GEORGIAN CENTER FOR AGRIBUSINESS DEVELOPMENT  GCAD  WILL RESEARCH WAYS TO IMPROVE THE STATISTICAL ANALYSIS PERFORMED BY NATIONAL STATISTICS OFFICE OF GEORGIA  GEOSTAT  AND LINKAGES THAT CAN BE MADE WITH THE GEORGIAN PRIVATE SECTOR. GCAD WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH GEOSTAT, USDA FAS AND NASS IN ORDER TO ENSURE PROPER IMPLEMENTATION OF THE RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. SPECIFICALLY, THE RESEARCH THAT WILL BE CONDUCTED BY GCAD WILL FURTHER THIS WORK BEING CONDUCTED BY NASS TO IMPROVE AGRICULTURAL STATISTICS TO BE MORE ACCURATE, TIMELY AND RELIABLE, PROVIDING CRITICAL MARKET INFORMATION TO THE BENEFIT OF GEORGIAN AND US AGRICULTURAL PRODUCERS. GCAD WILL RESEARCH KEY METHODOLOGIES FOR IMPROVING GEOSTAT S STATISTICAL ANALYSES BY CONDUCTING LARGE SCALE TRAININGS TO IDENTIFY MISSING SKILLS GAPS WHICH HAVE NOT OCCURRED FOR THE GEOSTAT ENUMERATORS FOR OVER THREE YEARS. TRAININGS WILL INCLUDE THE IMPORTANCE OF THE SURVEY, DETAILED TRAINING ON THE QUESTIONNAIRE, TRAINING AND PRACTICE ON THE TABLETS USED FOR ENUMERATION, STRATEGIES FOR ENCOURAGING RESPONSE AND METHODS FOR CONVERTING RELUCTANT RESPONDENTS, KNOWLEDGE EXCHANGE BETWEEN ENUMERATORS, AND AN OPPORTUNITY FOR FIELD STAFF TO SUGGEST IMPRO VEMENTS TO QUESTIONNAIRE AND OTHER ASPECTS OF THE AG SURVEY PROGRAM. NO SUBAWARDS ARE ANTICIPATED.

Award Type: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (B)
Description: THE AWARD WITH SECTORIAL PLATFORM FARMER OF FUTURE WILL SUPPORT ONGOING ASSESSMENTS AND RESEARCH IN THE WHEAT VALUE CHAIN BEING CONDUCTED BY USDA/FOREIGN AGRICULTURAL SERVICE AND OTHER PARTNERS. ASSESSMENTS BEING CONDUCTED INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED FIELD ASSESSMENTS INCLUDING WHEAT DISEASE ASSESSMENTS, MILLING ASSESSMENTS, AND BAKERY SECTOR ASSESSMENTS. THESE PURPOSE OF THESE ASSESSMENTS IS TO DETERMINE CONTRIBUTING FACTORS TO LOW WHEAT YIELDS IN THE COUNTRY OF GEORGIA. NO SUB-AWARDS ARE ANTICIPATED.

Award Type: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (B)
Description: THE WAR IN UKRAINE HAS WEAKENED THE UKRAINIAN SWINE SECTOR'S ABILITY TO PROPERLY ASSESS AND RESPOND TO BIOSECURITY THREATS. FAS AND IOWA STATE UNIVERSITY (ISU) ARE ENGAGING IN A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO ADDRESS GAPS IN BIOSECURITY KNOWLEDGE IN THE SWINE SECTOR.  ISU WILL WORK WITH FAS IMPLEMENTING PARTNER ASSOCIATION OF UKRAINIAN PIG BREEDERS (AUPB) TO PROVIDE EXPERTISE AND CREATE A VIRTUAL TRAINING SERIES ON SWINE HEALTH AND BIOSECURITY BEST PRACTICES. VIRTUAL TRAININGS WILL BE TARGETED TOWARDS UKRAINIAN SWINE SECTOR TECHNICAL EXPERTS, REGULATORY OFFICIALS, AND SWINE PRODUCERS. TRAININGS WILL BE FACILITATED IN COUNTRY BY AUPB AND WILL INCREASE LOCAL KNOWLEDGE AND COORDINATION FOR PROTECTING THE SWINE SECTOR FROM PESTS AND DISEASES SPREAD THROUGH MALPRACTICE. NO SUBAWARDS ARE ANTICIPATED.

Award Type: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (B)
Description: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS FOR BRIDGES TO CONDUCT A SERIES OF ASSESSMENTS IN COORDINATION WITH FAS TO DETERMINE THE CURRENT STATUS OF UKRAINIAN LIVESTOCK, SHEEP, GOAT, AND SWINE INDUSTRIES. AFTER THE ASSESSMENTS HAVE BEEN CONDUCTED,  RECOMMENDATIONS WILL BE PROVIDED ON HOW TO ASSIST UKRAINIAN LIVESTOCK, SHEEP, GOAT, AND SWINE INDUSTRIES TO AID IN THE RECOVERY AND REESTABLISH A SECURE FOOD SUPPLY BY ADDRESSING CONSTRAINTS IN VETERINARY MEDICINE AND SUPPLIES DUE TO THE ONGOING CONFLICT. BRIDGES IS BASED IN UKRAINE AND HAS THE ABILITY TO PROVIDE ON THE GROUND SUPPORT. NO SUBAWARDS ARE ANTICIPATED.

Award Type: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (B)
Description: UNDER THIS PROJECT THE AGRICULTURAL EXTENSION CENTER BRIDGES AND THE USDA FOREIGN AGRICULTURAL SERVICE (FAS) WILL CONDUCT A SERIES OF ASSESSMENTS TO INFORM ON THE CURRENT STATUS OF UKRAINIAN AGRICULTURE, AND PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS ON POTENTIAL POST-CONFLICT STRENGTHENING ACTIVITIES. THE QUESTIONS HAVE BEEN DESIGNED WITH INPUT FROM FAS/KYIV, FAS/GMA AND ERS, AND WILL HELP INFORM USDA MARKET INTELLIGENCE REPORTING, WHICH IS DIFFICULT DUE TO THE ONGOING CONFLICT, BUT CRITICALLY IMPORTANT BECAUSE OF THE SIZE AND IMPACT OF UKRAINIAN EXPORTS. AGRARNY DORADCHY TSENTR BRIDZHES (BRIDGES) WILL CONDUCT A SERIES OF RESEARCH ASSESSMENTS ON UKRAINIAN FARMER SENTIMENT FOR PLANTING, AND UKRAINIAN PROCESSORS AND EXPORTERS, TO PROVIDE INFORMATION TO FAS/KYIV, FAS/GMA AND USDA/ERS. BRIDGES WILL WORK WITH FAS TO ENSURE PROPER IMPLEMENTATION OF THE DATA GATHERING. BRIDGES WILL BE CONDUCTING EMAIL AND PHONE INTERVIEWS WITH FARMERS NATIONWIDE, WITH FOCUS ON FARMERS IN THE CONFLICT ZONE. THIS REPRESENTS CRITICAL PLANTING INFORMATION THAT IS CURRENTLY LACKING, DUE TO THE CHALLENGES OF FARMING IN A WAR ZONE. BECAUSE OF UKRAINE'S STATUS AS AN AGRICULTURAL POWERHOUSE, ESPECIALLY IN GRAINS AND OILSEEDS, THIS INFORMATION IS CRITICAL TO FAS OVERSEAS REPORTING MANDATE. NO SUB-AWARDS ARE ANTICIPATED.

PROVIDE SUPPORT TO MEMBER STATES AT TECHNICAL AND MINISTERIAL LEVELS, INCLUDING PREPARING MATERIALS AND BRIEFING NOTES FOR PARTICIPATION IN MEETINGS AS REQUIRED. FORMALIZATION AND REGULARIZATION OF WORKING GROUP MEETINGS TO ENSURE ALL MEMBER STATES ARE INFORMED PERIODICALLY AND DERIVE BENEFIT FROM THE INITIATIVES OF THE COALITION.

Description: THE AWARD WITH MISSISSIPPI STATE UNIVERSITY MSU WILL BOLSTER FISH HEALTH IN THE REPUBLIC OF GEORGIA TO STRENGTHEN THE TROUT FARMING AND PRODUCTION INDUSTRY IN THE SEMIAUTONOMOUS ADJARA REGION.  THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY A SERIES OF ASSESSMENTS AND IN-COUNTRY TRAININGS.  THE OVERALL GOAL FOR ADJARA REGION FISH FARMERS IS TO REDUCE FISH FRY LOSS AND INCREASE FAMER INCOME.  SPECIFICALLY, MSU WILL INVESTIGATE AND PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR REDUCING FRY AND ADULT TROUT LOSS BY PREVENTING AND REDUCING DISEASE OUTBREAKS.  THIS IS OF CRITICAL IMPORTANCE TO TROUT FARMERS IN ADJARA BECAUSE A SUBSTANTIAL PORTION OF THEIR FRY PRODUCTION ARE LOST LONG BEFORE IT CAN BE SOLD. ADDITIONALLY, AT PRESENT TROUT FARMING IN ADJARA IS A RISKY ENDEAVOR BECAUSE THE THREAT OF SUBSTANTIAL LOSS DUE TO DISEASE OUTBREAK IS RATHER HIGH. MANY TROUT FARMS WITHIN ADJARA GO OUT OF BUSINESS BECAUSE OF THIS VOLATILITY. NO SUBAWARDS ARE ANTICIPATED
